sense.gloss: to abuse (verbally), to curse at, to shout abuse at, to speak ill of
(verbal) abuse, denunciation, disparagement, vilification, scathing criticism
all manner of (verbal) abuse, all kinds of names, abusive language, torrent of abuse, stream of insults
reviling, vilification, abusive language, lashing someone using abusive language, speaking abusively of someone

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓はそれまでにこれほど↑罵倒↑↓ばとう↓にみちた↑手紙↑↓てがみ↓を↑受↑↓う↓け↑取↑↓と↓ったことはなかった。
sdata.e: I had never received such an abusive letter before.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓を↑罵↑↓ののし↓った。
↑彼↑↓かれ↓らは↑声↑↓こえ↓の↑限↑↓かぎ↓りに↑罵↑↓ののし↓りあった。
sdata.e: They were swearing at each other at the top of their voices.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓を↑馬鹿↑↓ばか↓だの↑何↑↓なに↓だのと↑罵↑↓ののし↓った。
sdata.e: She called me a fool and what not.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑面↑↓めん↓と↑向↑↓む↓かって↑夫↑↓おっと↓を↑罵↑↓ののし↓った。
sdata.e: She called her husband names to his face.

sdata.j: はい、↑大阪↑↓おおさか↓でも↑相手↑↓あいて↓に↑罵詈↑↓ばり↓↑雑言↑↓ぞうごん↓を↑浴↑↓あ↓びせるとき、アホと↑言↑↓い↓います。
sdata.e: Yes, in Osaka, too, we say "idiot" when we are insulting someone.

sdata.j: トムは↑怒↑↓おこ↓って、メアリーを↑罵倒↑↓ばとう↓した。
sdata.e: Tom got mad and called Mary names.
